page.title: 13THE GLYNDE VILLAGE SHOP
page.content: The present shopkeeper has managed the shop for the last 7 years. There has been a shop here for 150 years. The previous shopkeepers had the shop before for 25 years. The shop belongs to the Glynde estates and the shopkeeper had to be interviewed before she could run it. The shop was originally the coach house of the Pear Tree Inn which was next door. It is now the only shop in Glynde but there used to be a bakers, wheelwrights, forge and a butcher. The shop sells groceries, cards, rabbit food, footballs, small toys and second hand books. A baker comes round to the houses but the shop sells bread as well.
